resources.string: Move brush from top to bottom

string.name: badbreath
string.Data:
Bad Breath


• Brush and floss your teeth twice daily.

• Brush your tongue with the tongue scraper.

• Eat plenty of citrus fruits like lemon, oranges, amla etc.

• Prevent dry mouth by using sugar-free chewing gums, lozenges, mints.

• Brushing teeth with baking soda helps neutralize excess acid found in oral cavity so reduces bad breath.

string.name: sensitivity
string.Data:
Sensitivity

• Apply desensitizing paste on the affected teeth with your fingertips after normal brushing and leave it for 5 min, then rinse with water. Repeat this two times per day.

• Have low acidic diet e.g. Banana, apples, rice, almonds etc.

• Avoid horizontal brushing and use vertical brushing technique.

string.name: oralulcers
string.Data:
Oral Ulcers

• Apply glycerine or ghee on ulcers.

• Eat more of fresh fruits mainly oranges, pomegranate, amla etc.

• Drink cold milk which neutralizes acids.

• Have vitamin B complex tablets once daily.

• Avoid unnecessary painkillers.

string.name: toothache
string.Data:
Tooth Ache

• Clean the cavity with a toothpick to remove the entrapped food particles.

• Do salt water gargling with lukewarm water.

• Holding a clove underneath that tooth will relieve pain temporarily.

• Avoid smoking, drinking alcohol, pricking by needles and pins etc.

string.name: stainedteeth
string.Data:
Stained Teeth

• Brush your teeth twice daily.

• Don’t have more than 2 cups of coffee or tea in a day.

• Avoid smoking, drinking alcohol.

• Don’t use mouthwash in full concentration, dilute it with water.

• Visit your dentist every six months for proper teeth cleaning.

string.name: bleedinggums
string.Data:
Bleeding Gums

• Apply clove oil on affected gums.

• Apply aloe vera gel on affected gums.

• Salt water gargling twice daily will help reduce bleeding gums.

• Eat more of citrus fruits like lemon, oranges, amla and fresh vegetables.

string.name: generalcare
string.Data:
General Care

• Brush your teeth twice daily - morning and night.

• After brushing clean your tongue with a tongue scraper.

• Brushing only cleans 60% of surfaces, so use floss to clean rest of area.

• Use mouthwash after diluting it with water, mouthwash contains some antibacterial agents which prevent gum problems and fluoride helps to prevent decay.

• Maintain healthy diet containing green vegetables and fresh fruits.

• Avoid acidic drinks and beverages, such as soft drinks.

• Avoid smoking, drinking and chewing tobacco.

• Visit your dentist every 6 months for a complete checkup.

string.name: foodlodgement
string.Data:
Food Lodgement

• Brush and rinse your teeth thoroughly immediately after food.

• Avoid horizontal brushing and use vertical brushing technique.

• Interdental flossing provides fast relief.

string.name: cavity
string.Data:
Cavity

• Dilute 2-3 drops of clove(laung) oil with ¼ of sesame(til) oil. Put few drops of oil on a cotton ball and dab the solution on the affected tooth.

• Dissolve 1 tsp of salt in one glass of warm water. Use this solution to rinse for 1 min, concentrating on the affected teeth. Follow this treatment 3 times daily until symptoms subside.

• See your dentist.

string.name: restrictedmouthopening
string.Data:
Restricited Mouth Opening

• Eat plenty of vitamin-rich foods like carrots, oranges, mangoes, spinach, tomatoes etc.

• Stretch your mouth by piling ice-cream sticks between teeth.

• Avoid unnecessary painkillers.

• If you smoke or use betel nut, quit immediately.

resources.string: Brushing at night reduced your chance of getting a heart attack.
